text:
Hi Community,

Has anybody ever found a way to use a two-column layout email for an external RSS feed in HubSpot?I created a custom module and notice it does not pull in the images in the two-column layout.

In a one-column layout using the HubSpot UI to just add the external RSS feed it works however its not the design I want
<https://begradient-4623912.hs-sites.com/-temporary-slug-7b0f4893-8a86-41ba-b65d-a5c425f2d423?hs_preview=fwfVvGEk-12696395190>
<https://begradient-4623912.hs-sites.com/-temporary-slug-af03346e-a3f3-4f5a-a906-62db0a9810af?hs_preview=VsTwCBgD-12783562435>

I have an html template using a include:
`<footer>`
`    {% include 'generated_global_groups/xxxxx.html' %}`

`</footer>`

I would like to change this to use the new path method, what is the best route to do that? If I “View Source” of the Global Group, would I think create a module and then reference that module using a path?

Hey <@UF6M5BW4C>! To confirm, you are wanting to include a Drag and Drop global group?

We are actually working on support for including Global Groups by their true path within a file project. Alternatively, you could create a global module, and include that by path as you noted.

cross posting here in hopes of a response:

*How do I get a link field in a custom module to send the user to an anchor tag?*

All I can seem to get to work is to use an external link, but it would be nice not to rely on a static url. Also super annoying in that it triggers a page reload, which is too much extra

thanks in advance

It would be nice if HS allowed for the 'Page Link with URL Parameter' option here, but they do not. In the past I've added a text field to append to the page link. So the page link field would be <http://www.whatever.com/about|www.whatever.com/about> and then the anchor field is just a simple text field where the user adds anchor text. So if they add 'jon' in the text field, the final URL would be <http://www.whatever.com/about#jon|www.whatever.com/about#jon>.
for some reason this isnt working `rgba( {{ convert_rgb(module.background_color.color) }}, {{ module.background_color.opacity }} )`
it says it Could not resolve function ‘convert_rgb’
idiot
sorry guys
hey now.
Thanks <@UB690RZA7>! i'll give this a whirl
how many events would be in the blog? you could go the api route and use javascript

Hey <@U6W3H6YN8>. thanks for the update, I knew about support for paths for modules, did not know it was extending to global group dnd, so any particular timing of when that is being releases across portals? I am working with HTML templates now that reference the global groups so just wondering

Reposting this just in case it got missed last Friday afternoon :stuck_out_tongue:

Is it possible to format personalization tokens? I’m trying to add them as a query string to a url that the user is redirected to after submitting a form. `<http://redirect-url.com/?industry={{contact.industry%7Creplace(|redirect-url.com/?industry={{contact.industry|replace(>' ', '+')}}`doesn’t seem to be working. What’s the best way to get that information in a query string?
have you tried the `urlencode` filter?
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-filters#urlencode>
Filters don’t seem to be working in general (good to know about that one though!). What I get returned is `?industry=CONTACT.INDUSTRY`
are you previewing the page as a contact that has that custom property?
should probably wrap the whole thing in an if statement in case someone is not a contact
you’ll have a lot more options with HubDB and it’ll be faster. Blogs were not really meant for this use case.
hey everyone :wave:  is there a way to see what variables are available to use in an email template?
